alert.note: Alert for Washington (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 4:10PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Washington County through 445 PM CDT... At 410 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Jackson, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Slinger, Germantown, Richfield and Kirchhayn. People attending Action in Jackson should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
